alert.note: Alert for Northwest Deserts (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued December 23 at 7:46PM MST until December 24 at 5:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE FLAG BURN AREA REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Flag Burn Area. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arizona, including the following area, Northwest Deserts. * WHEN...Through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Flag Burn Area is expected up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near the Flag Burn Area including Pine Lake and Hualapai Mountain Park should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the Flag Burn Area, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. Rain is expected to begin this evening and continue heavy at times tonight and into Friday. Rainfall totals are expected to average 1.5 to 2.5 inches. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
